body_html: There is an ordering guarantee for .parameters(). This is why we use OrderedDicts everywhere. They're always going to appear in that list in the same order in which they were assigned in the constructor. So it should all work fine, except that I think that DP might scatter them in memory
body_text: There is an ordering guarantee for .parameters(). This is why we use OrderedDicts everywhere. They're always going to appear in that list in the same order in which they were assigned in the constructor. So it should all work fine, except that I think that DP might scatter them in memory
body: There is an ordering guarantee for `.parameters()`. This is why we use `OrderedDict`s everywhere. They're always going to appear in that list in the same order in which they were assigned in the constructor. So it should all work fine, except that I think that DP might scatter them in memory
